title: Adega Viuva Gomes 1931 Tinto Red (Colares)
description: This remarkable wine looks old, and with its dry tannins, is now tasting old. Unlike the 1934 from the same producer that still has fruit, this is beginning to fade. Drink this wine for its amazing story—ungrafted vines planted low in the ground on sandy soil—as much as for its flavors.

title: Analemma 2014 Oak Ridge Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: Coming from a vineyard in the foothills of Mt. Adams, this wine offers quite light aromas of mineral, lychee, and spice. The just off-dry palate is more giving, with elegantly styled floral flavors that linger.

title: Azienda Agricola Monti 2008 Pignotto Riserva  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane)
description: Dark spice, new leather, ripe plum and a whiff of grilled herb aromas take center stage on this hearty red. The full-bodied palate offers mature blackberry, dried black cherry, tobacco and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2018.

title: Basalt 2012 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas of dark plum, green herb and coffee bring a sense of purity. The flavors are soft, silky and elegant, with espresso notes lingering on the finish. It shows a sense of finesse.

title: Bodegas Perica 2014 6 cepas 6 Viura-Verdejo Viura-Verdejo (Rioja)
description: This gold-tinted, barrel-fermented Viura-Verdejo blend shows aromas of dry apple, fino Sherry and bready yeast. The palate feels plump and balanced, while baked apple flavors come with a salty note that adds complexity. A firm dry lightly oaked finish keeps this on course.

title: Dubost 2010 Gran Reserva Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dense black cherry and blueberry fruit lead into a candied-grape element on the nose of this wine that also offers maple syrup, vanilla and lilac touches. The blend of 60% Malbec, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Syrah is fruity on the sip, with kirsch and crème de cassis flavors held up by strong tannins and acidity.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Baked black cherry and black plum meet with dark loam depth and a freshness provided by dill and anise on the nose of this bottling. Dried black-plum skins make for a chewy palate that is intensely dry and extremely structured.

title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2015 Golpe White (Douro)
description: A blend of classic Douro white grapes, this is a perfumed, textured wine. Still young, it shows green fruits, sliced apples and a lemon-zest aftertaste. With all its acidity, the wine needs to calm down a little, so drink from late 2017.

title: Marchand & Burch 2014 Villages Chardonnay (Western Australia)
description: This medium-bodied Chardonnay kicks off with nutty notes of baked meringue layered over plump pear and melon fruit. There's a bit of toasted-grain as well, and a focused, lemony finish that lingers. Drink now–2019.

title: Johannishof 2015 Johannisberg S Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Perfumed sprays of fresh green florals and crushed minerals lift this elegant off-dry Riesling. The palate is delicate and sprightly, full of zesty gooseberry and green plum flavors. An undertone of bramble lends a savoriness that lingers through the finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: St. Christopher 2014 Qualitätswein Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)
description: Whiffs of apple, pear and lemon suggest a shyer aromatic expression of Gewürztraminer, but the palate of this off-dry wine is surprisingly sunny and bright. Fresh tangerine and nectarine flavors are accented by hints of caramel and bee pollen. The finish lingers on a delicately lacy sweetness.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2015 Gewürztraminer (Pfalz)
description: Delicate notes of white blossom, lemon and lime on the nose are emboldened on the palate of this gorgeously floral Gewürztraminer. It's off-dry in style, with musky, exotic tones of spice and potpourri that linger sexily through the finish. Briskly balanced acidity and a hint of tea tannins lend tautness in structure.

title: Refugio Ranch 2015 Tiradora Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This bottling, which includes 20% Sémillon, offers aromas of cut grass, sliced Anjou pear and a lemon-lime freshness on the nose. Sour Granny Smith apple and green lime rinds rule the palate, making for a solid and classic style of Sauv Blanc.

title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2014 Passagem Red (Douro)
description: Full of tannins and with the potential of ripe fruit, this wine is young, concentrated and powerful. The alcohol does show as a burn of pepper at the end, spoiling an otherwise well-balanced wine. Produced from a 200-acre vineyard in the Douro Superior, the wine should be ready from 2019.

title: Graziano 2012 Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: This wine is mild and smooth compared to its peers, with good berry and cherry flavors, a broad, moderately tannic texture and a nice sense of layering.

title: Pflücken 2015 Sweet Riesling (Mosel)
description: Spicy notes of cinnamon and sugar cookie lend warmth to this juicy, sweet-tart blend of yellow cherry, peach, and apricot flavors. It's unabashedly fruit forward yet balanced neatly with zesty acidity and a touch of bitter lime pith on the finish.

title: Vinessens 2013 Sein Monastrell-Syrah (Alicante)
description: Plum and blueberry aromas display a hint of desert herbs. A full dense palate is jammy in feel, while blackberry and prune flavors come with herbal savory notes. A mix of toasty oak and prune-like flavors on the finish leave a lasting impression of maximum ripeness. Drink through 2021.

title: The Islander 2013 Wally White Semillon (Kangaroo Island)
description: Frenchman Jacques Lurton fell in love with Kangaroo Island (off the coast of South Australia) and has applied his winemaking background to crafting some fine wines there. This barrel-ferment and -aged Semillon stands well apart from mainland examples, delivering toasty, mealy aromas and plenty of breadth on the palate before ending long and oaky. Drink now–2025.

title: Thomas Schmitt 2015 Private Collection Estate Bottled Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Cutting lemon, gooseberry and starfruit aromas lend a refreshingly green tone to this sprightly off-dry Riesling. The palate, by contrast, suggests more ripeness, offering loads of sweet-tart tangerine, melon and pineapple. The finish is long yet pristinely fresh.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Fresh-pressed raspberry, plums, dried sagebrush, wild thyme and a touch of mustard plant show on the nose of this wine, recalling a hike through the chaparral. Light but ripe cranberry fruit shows on the easygoing sip, alongside oregano, vanilla and rhubarb.

title: Substance 2014 Super Substance Sb Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)
description: Hailing from Sunset Vineyard in the Ancient Lakes appellation, this wine starts out aromatically quiet, with notes of green apple, toasted Grape-Nuts and herb. The palate is sleek and lightly creamy, lingering on the finish.

title: Syncline 2014 Carignan-Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Carignan (70%) takes the lead on this one-of-a-kind-in-the-state wine. It offers aromas of bramble, assorted vegetables and piercing purple fruit. The flavors are light and elegant, fresh and pure, trailing toward the finish.

title: Nino Negri 2013 Inferno  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Woodland berry, wild rose and a whiff of crushed stone aromas come together on this luminous red. The vibrant silky palate offers tart red cherry, Alpine herb and a hint of white pepper alongside bright acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2019.

title: Yalumba 2015 The Y Series Viognier (South Australia)
description: A terrific value, this offers a surprising amount of varietal character for the price. Ripe apricot and nectarine elements give a weighty impression on the palate, while grapefruit prolongs the warm, round finish. Drink now.

title: Gård 2015 Grand Klasse Reserve Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Pale peach in color, this wine brings aromas of strawberry and orange peel. It drinks dry with a broad textured feel, needing a bit more acidity to stitch it all together but still delivering plenty of enjoyment.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Morgon)
description: This is a firm, still very young wine from a Beaujolais cru that needs to age. So its tannins are still to the fore, although black fruits are in the background ready to push forward over the next year. The juicy acidity at the end is already attractive. Drink from 2018.

title: La Crema 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is smooth as silk—supple and soft, with pretty cherry fruit and highlights of cocoa powder and coffee grounds. It's a professionally built wine all the way, made for easy enjoyment, with satiny tannins and a touch of anise.

title: White Rose 2014 Anderson Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Compact and battened down tightly, this tart, challenging wine is striated with layers of rhubarb, stem, earth and stone. The complexity is appealing, though some tasters will be looking for more robust fruit in a wine in this price range.

title: Château Siaurac 2014 Plaisir de Siaurac  (Lalande de Pomerol)
description: Produced from young vines at Château Siaurac, the wine, dominated by 90% Merlot, is generous, approachable and ripe. It was matured in tank rather than wood, allowing the black fruits to come through strongly. The aftertaste brings out fruitiness as much as the gentle tannins.

title: Castell 2014 Casteller Reitsteig Spätburgunder (Franken)
description: Fresh, cutting cassis and cranberry acidity lend vitality to this bright, perky Spätburgunder. The palate boasts crisp, primary black chery and berry flavors marked by a pleasant touch of nuttiness. Fine-grained tannins are easy and approachable on the finish. Drink now through 2021.
